    • Constructor Detail

      • GPIO

        public GPIO(GPIO.ConnectionInfo info)
        Initializes the GPIO object that allows you to connect to WebIOPi. This object provides a series of utility functions that help you to control WebIOPi using REST calls.
        Parameters:
        info - Connection information for the host runing WebIOPi

    • Method Detail

      • getPinmap

        public java.util.ArrayList<GPIOPin> getPinmap()
        getPinMap returns the current GPIO pin mapping for the raspberry PI.
        Returns:
        Current ping mapping as an ArrayList

      • setPinmap

        public void setPinmap(java.util.ArrayList<GPIOPin> map)
        setPinmap forces the change of current pin mapping. GPIO tries to acquire the current pin mapping from WebIOPi. Sometimes, like when we cannot connect to the remote host we want to be able to establish a default port mapping for reference purposes.
        Parameters:
        map -

      • outputPulse

        public void outputPulse(int port)
        outputPulse sends a single pulse to the specified GPIO port. This method works in an asynchronous way starting a new Thread to make the request and ends.

        If there is any connection exceptions it generates a "ConnectionEvent", this is useful to detect if GPIO is disconnected from the target host

        Parameters:
        port - Port number to output the pulse

      • outputSequence

        public void outputSequence(int port,
                  int delay,
                  java.lang.String seq)
        outputSequence sends a sequence of bits to the specified GPIO port with the delay specified. The sequence is specified as a string of 0 and 1 characters. It doesn't validate the string sent. This method works in an asynchronous way starting a new Thread to make the request and ends.

        If there is any connection exceptions it generates a "ConnectionEvent", this is useful to detect if GPIO is disconnected from the target host.

        Parameters:
        port - Port number to output the sequence
        delay - Delay (in milliseconds) between pulses
        seq - A string composed of 0 and 1 characters to output.

      • outputPWMDutyCycle

        public void outputPWMDutyCycle(int port,
                      float ratio)
        outputPWMDutyCicle outputs a PWM signal to the specified GPIO port using the specified duty cycle ratio. 0 equals always off (0%) and 1 equals (100%) always on. This method only works on ports configured as PWM. This method works in an asynchronous way starting a new Thread to make the request and ends.

        If there is any connection exceptions it generates a "ConnectionEvent", this is useful to detect if GPIO is disconnected from the target host.

        Parameters:
        port - Target port number
        ratio - Pulse width ratio

      • outputPWMServoAngle

        public void outputPWMServoAngle(int port,
                       int angle)
        outputPWMServoAngle outputs a PWM signal to the specified GPIO port using the specified servo motor angle. The range for "angle" could be from 0 to 359. This method only works on ports configured as PWM. This method works in an asynchronous way starting a new Thread to make the request and ends.

        If there is any connection exceptions it generates a "ConnectionEvent", this is useful to detect if GPIO is disconnected from the target host.

        Parameters:
        port - Target port number
        angle - Target angle in degrees

      • setValue

        public void setValue(int port,
            int value)
        setValue changes the current value on the GPIO port. You can call this method at any time but it only works on ports configured as output. This method works in an asynchronous way starting a new Thread to make the request and ends.

        If there is any connection exceptions it generates a "ConnectionEvent", this is useful to detect if GPIO is disconnected from the target host.

        Parameters:
        port - Target port number
        value - Target port value

      • getValue

        public PORTVALUE getValue(int port)
        getValue returns the current port value. It returns an enumeration representing the current port value. This method works in an asynchronous way starting a new Thread to make the request and ends.

        If there is any connection exceptions it generates a "ConnectionEvent", this is useful to detect if GPIO is disconnected from the target host.

        Parameters:
        port - Target port
        Returns:
        current port value

      • setFunction

        public void setFunction(int port,
               PORTFUNCTION funct)
        setFunction changes the specified port function. This method works in an asynchronous way starting a new Thread to make the request and ends.

        If there is any connection exceptions it generates a "ConnectionEvent", this is useful to detect if GPIO is disconnected from the target host.

        Parameters:
        port - Target port
        funct - New port function

      • getFunction

        public PORTFUNCTION getFunction(int port)
        getFunction returns the current port function. It doesn't generates a REST request because it's supposed that a background thread is updating the internal state of GPIO ports
        Parameters:
        port - Target port
        Returns:
        Current port function

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        isConnected returns if GPIO is currently connected to WebIOPi.
        Returns:
        true on connected false otherwise.

      • addPortUpdateListener

        public void addPortUpdateListener(GPIO.PortUpdateListener listener)
        addPortUpdateListener adds update listeners to the current GPIO connection. The listeners are called each time that GPIO pools WebIOPi.
        Parameters:
        listener -

      • removePortUpdateListener

        public void removePortUpdateListener(GPIO.PortUpdateListener listener)
        removePortUpdateListener removes an update listener from the current list of update listeners.
        Parameters:
        listener -

      • addPortConnectionListener

        public void addPortConnectionListener(GPIO.ConnectionEventListener listener)
        addPortConnectionListener adds a new collection listener. This listeners are used to identify when GPIO disconnects from WebIOPi.
        Parameters:
        listener - to be added.

      • removePortConnectionListener

        public void removePortConnectionListener(GPIO.ConnectionEventListener listener)
        removePortConnectionListener removes a connection listener from the current list of connection listeners.
        Parameters:
        listener -

      • getPinNum

        public int getPinNum(int gpioNum)
        getPinNum returns the physical pin number less one. If the GPIO port doesn't have a pin assigned it returns the value -1.
        Parameters:
        gpioNum - GPIO number
        Returns:
        Pin number

      • run

        public void run()
        Main background task GPIO is designed to work in background. It can be started creating a new Thread. The main loop is going to continue while it can connect to WebIOPi and parse the resulting data.

        After each successful request and parse of JSON data it calls onPortUpdate for the PortUpdateListener registered.

        Each loop is treated as a "transaction", if any exceptions are found it breaks the main loops and ends the thread. onConnectionFailed is called on all ConnnectionListeners if there any registered.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
